perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be in full force and effect commencing on January 2, 2020 and shall remain in effect for one (1) year or until Consultant completes the services requested. Either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement without notice in the event of the bankruptcy, insolvency, or assignment for the benefit of creditors of the other Party. Either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement with notice, and the effective date of termination shall be the date such notice is received (by mail, overnight delivery, or fax) by the terminated Party.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be in full force and effect commencing on January 2, 2020 and shall remain in effect for one (1) year. Either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement without notice in the event of the bankruptcy, insolvency, or assignment for the benefit of creditors of the other Party. Either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement with thirty (30) days notice, and the effective date of termination shall be thirty (30) days from when such notice is received (by mail, overnight delivery, or fax) by the terminated Party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the agreement lasts for one year or until services are complete, then allows termination with immediate notice. The modified version removes the 'until services are completed' clause, making the one-year term absolute. Then introduces termination with 30 days notice, conflicting with the immediate termination clause for bankruptcy or insolvency. This creates ambiguity about when and how the contract can be terminated, especially if services are completed before the one-year mark.

perturbation.original_text: Consultant shall devote such time and efforts to the affairs of the Company as is reasonably necessary to render the services contemplated by this Agreement. Consultant is not responsible for the performance of any services that may be rendered hereunder if the Company fails to provide the requested information in writing prior thereto. The services of Consultant shall not include the rendering of any legal opinions or the performance of any work that is in the ordinary purview of a certified public accountant. Consultant cannot guarantee results on behalf of the Company but shall use commercially reasonable efforts in providing the services listed above. Consultant's duty is to identify prospective acquisition/joint venture companies for the Company. Consultant will in no way act as a "broker-dealer" under state securities laws. Because all final decisions pertaining to any particular investment are to be made by the Company, the Company may be required to communicate directly with potential acquisition/joint venture prospective companies.
perturbation.changed_text: Consultant shall devote such time and efforts to the affairs of the Company as is reasonably necessary to render the services contemplated by this Agreement. Consultant is fully responsible for the performance of any services that may be rendered hereunder, even if the Company fails to provide the requested information in writing prior thereto. The services of Consultant shall include the rendering of legal opinions and the performance of any work that is in the ordinary purview of a certified public accountant. Consultant guarantees results on behalf of the Company and shall use commercially reasonable efforts in providing the services listed above. Consultant's duty is to identify prospective acquisition/joint venture companies for the Company. Consultant will act as a "broker-dealer" under state securities laws. Because all final decisions pertaining to any particular investment are to be made by the Company, the Company may be required to communicate directly with potential acquisition/joint venture prospective companies.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the original by stating the consultant IS responsible for services even without information, WILL provide legal opinions/accounting work, and DOES guarantee results. This creates significant legal risk and ambiguity regarding the consultant's obligations and liabilities.

perturbation.original_text: The Company further acknowledges and agrees that the identity of the subject Opportunities, and all other information concerning an Opportunity (including without limitation, all mailing information, phone and fax numbers, email addresses and other contact information) introduced hereunder are the property of Consultant, and shall be treated as confidential information by the Company, it affiliates, officers, directors, shareholders, employees, agents, representatives, successors and assigns. The Company shall not use such information, except in the context of any arrangement with Consultant in which Consultant is directly and actively involved, and never without Consultant's prior written approval. The Company further agrees that neither it nor its employees, affiliates or assigns, shall enter into, or otherwise arrange (either for it/him/herself, or any other person or entity) any business relationship, contact any person regarding such Opportunity, either directly or indirectly, or any of its affiliates, or accept any compensation or advantage in relation to such Opportunity except as directly though Consultant, without the prior written approval of Consultant.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company further acknowledges and agrees that the identity of the subject Opportunities, and all other information concerning an Opportunity (including without limitation, all mailing information, phone and fax numbers, email addresses and other contact information) introduced hereunder are NOT the property of Consultant, and shall NOT be treated as confidential information by the Company, it affiliates, officers, directors, shareholders, employees, agents, representatives, successors and assigns. The Company shall use such information freely, without the context of any arrangement with Consultant and without Consultant's prior written approval. The Company further agrees that it nor its employees, affiliates or assigns, shall enter into, or otherwise arrange (either for it/him/herself, or any other person or entity) any business relationship, contact any person regarding such Opportunity, either directly or indirectly, or any of its affiliates, or accept any compensation or advantage in relation to such Opportunity except as directly though Consultant, without the prior written approval of Consultant.
perturbation.explanation: This change flips the entire non-circumvention clause. Originally the company agreed not to use the Consultant's opportunities without their involvement. The modified text states they *can* freely use the information (contradicting the confidentiality agreement) but then oddly retains the requirement for Consultant's approval *if* doing so outside their direct involvement. This creates a contradiction; if the information isn't confidential and can be freely used, why would approval still be needed under certain circumstances?
